website_summaries.verdict: Despite poor documentation, this is a versatile 5-channel interface and mixer that offers a lot of bells and whistles.
pros: Features include 5 channels in all, with a 2-band EQ and pan on each channel
Pro-level audio sound, with ultra-low noise design
cons: There is no way to monitor your signal while recording
The documentation is a little limited

customer_reviews.title: Garbage product, don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: They should really stop selling this piece of garbage. No where in the product description does it say that you can't record the line input to the mixer on your computer. That's right, the computer only records the MIC input. This thing is completely useless if you plan to record the line input on the computer. They really should mention this in the product description. I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Newsome

customer_reviews.title: Choose monitor or send to main output, can't do both
customer_reviews.text: How do you have a switch that is EITHER main line OR monitor? Can't I monitor while it's going out to the main output? This is one of the dumbest design decisions that I've seen in a mixer. Since when do you have to decide between monitoring your levels via headphones or send to the live output? Would not work for cueing and testing levels in a performance scenario (or any reasonable scenario, for that matter). Monitor when you set up and pray it is fine for the rest of the time you're using the mixer, because you can't listen to both.
customer_reviews.author: Slartibart Jones

customer_reviews.title: Pro quality audio at a budget price.
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic, Audio to the computer is as clear as my $500 PreSonus mixer. no drivers needed at all on Mac/OSX Noise floor is below -80db Honestly this thing is absolutely usable by anyone trying to do pro level recording.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D. Gray

customer_reviews.title: the ideal little mixer, BUT
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small 3 input mixer that I could capture a blend of the Mic input and stereo Line inputs into my computer. While this device supposedly will do this, after testing 3 of the same models and talking with Pyle support, it's apparent this device only captures the mic input to the computer (usb). Otherwise, it operates as expected mixing between the sources to the audio outputs & headphones. As stated, only the mic input will route to the usb port for computer capturing.
customer_reviews.author: Travis F Smith

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, solid, easy to hook up and learn on, far (far) superior than a no control Phantom PSU!
customer_reviews.text: Ugh, so much better than the Phantom power supply I got with my microphone, the ability to actually load other sources of audio and mix it simultaneously and then monitor all through the USB both ways is invaluable! Solid metal build, the knobs are sturdy and stiff right out of the box and I'm looking forward to this lasting years. Honestly if you buy a XLR mic don't bother getting a no-control Phantom PSU! Get this PAD20MXU!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gilman

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Sent two back because they don’t work properly. The line in doesn’t feed into the usb even though you can hear it through the monitor. Customer service is terrible - spent hours on the phone trying to get it sorted. Got a reply finally on messenger after two weeks apologising and never heard from them again. The build of the mixer felt good so I was hoping it would at least work but the sound was low quality and None of the switches did anything. Spend more and buy something decent.

customer_reviews.title: Audio Interface???

customer_reviews.title: Compact battery powered mixer
customer_reviews.text: Very good size for what I was looking for: small battery powered mixer to use for street performances or when ac power is not available. Light enough to put on shelf attached to portable music stand. Works well with lav mic (but you must use converter). LED colors do not match what is described in manual. LED stays red while charging and goes off when fully charged. There is noise when trying to use this while charging, but this is not a problem for me. I do wish I could add a little reverb to channel 1 (mic).
customer_reviews.author: J. McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built. A very nice audio mixer/interface for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at how solidly built this little mixer was. I suppose for the price I was expecting something cheap feeling. This little mixer has some heft. It's made of metal, the knobs are not loose and have the perfect amount of resistance when turning them., switches are solid and not springy or squishy. I'm using the mixer as an interface with Tracktion 7 and it's been working great. It runs silent and adds no noise to recording. I am very happy with my Pyle 2-Channel Audio Mixer.
customer_reviews.author: GDoobah

customer_reviews.title: Pyle SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this mixer 11/21/17 and 1 year later main fader died very bad static output. I sent it in to Sound around the pyle distributer who repaired it. Now 7/19 7 months later the left channel output died. And guess what? my warranty has expired. But all in a nut shell DO NOT PURCHASE PYLE EQUIPMENT!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terance Poindexter

customer_reviews.title: Questionable durability and sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Mine just shorted out and broke after about 10 months of use. I loved the i/o options on this interface. Adjusting the volume on any knob results in some audible distortion until you stop turning the knob (which always bothered me). This thing had some nice features but it apparently wasn't built to withstand daily use. When I turned on my computer this morning, I saw the lights on the mixer flash a few times, heard some pops, and then this mixer was bricked. I can't return it, so now I'm without sound until I can find a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kyler T Jobe

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I needed a USB audio interface to use for web meetings with a guitar player. This is the cheapest I could get my hands on. It’s exactly what it is, not amazing or fantastic at all, but very practical and easy to use. It also is capable of providing a 22v phantom power off of the USB so that works great since we are using a condenser mic for the guitarist! If it meets your needs, this is a useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price... Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: If you simply need an interface for your microphone or instrument to connect to your computer, then this device will get the job done. If you are using recording software, make sure your Mic Cable, or any cable, works properly or you'll get errors on your program. Sound is good. Works with Windows 10 just fine. Recommended for lower end budgets like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Josh G

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile and can be used for many applications.
customer_reviews.text: I have my computer and a bass guitar rig hooked up in both channels and playing through home stereo system so that I can practice at low volume at home . B is very quiet does not get hot in the volume controls provide plenty of Headroom to use with your amplifier . I am very pleased with this item .
customer_reviews.author: Monty Pop

customer_reviews.title: 18 volt Phantom Power Is Useless With Large Diaphragm Condenser Microphones
customer_reviews.text: Before ordering this mixer I read that this mixer provided phantom power for condenser microphones. But when the mixer arrived I soon found out that the 18 volt phantom power that this mixer is supposed to be providing was not enough to power a large diaphragm condenser microphone adequately. So if you're planning to use this mixer with a large diaphragm condenser microphone that requires closer 48 volts of phantom power. Though this mixer did work sufficiently with a smaller dynamic lapel microphone. My larger condenser microphone could barely be heard unless the gain was turned to full and you had so much hiss it made the mixer useless for recording.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bragg

customer_reviews.title: Great Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is great, nice and compact and metal construction, portable and USB powered. Deal breaker, when you output signal, it kills headphone monitoring. Plus I noticed that the USB audio was not coming out of the left channel much. Not balanced. Don't know if this was a software issue.

The Pyle 5-Channel DJ Audio Mixer adds convenient, next level USB interface audio processing. The compact console controller includes a combo XLR / 1/4'' microphone input, two stereo RCA inputs, and two 3.5mm stereo output and monitor jacks. The built-in rechargeable battery allows for portable use, for quick DJ sound setups. Versatile compatibility allows you to connect to your audio equipment for instant mixing and music processing. It works with virtually all recording software on laptops or computers -- Mac and Windows compatible. Configurable 2-band EQ and smooth rotary faders grant independent channel adjustment for fine-tuning your sound. Provides 18V phantom power over the microphone jack.
feature_bullets: RECORD AND CONNECT TO PC: This personal mixer has a USB soundcard and audio interface to record and connect to MAC or PC and it has universal digital audio file compatibility. Can be used by beginners or studio professional applications

LOW NOISE DESIGN: This portable 5 channel DJ console sound controller mixer has an ultra-low noise design with high headroom. It can mix, blend and create music with any audio equipment. It is extremely musical with 2-band EQ and Pan on each channel

5 CHANNELS: The device caters multiple device connectivity because it has 5 channels. It has 1 XLR / 1/4'' jack combo microphone input, 2 RCA stereo Inputs and 2 1/8'' (3.5mm) stereo output plus monitor jacks

LED INDICATOR LIGHTS: The recording mixer has LED indicator lights and audio signal clips for user convenience. It has input selection, knobs, master volume controls, independent channel balance and high, plus, low-frequency adjustment

18V PHANTOM POWER: For the reliable power source, this DJ mixer comes with an 18V Phantom power supply. Includes USB wall adapter power supply and connection cable. It even has an integrated rechargeable Lithium-Ion battery with 500mAh 3.7V
